definitions.definition: A bundle of thin sticks, typically made of wood, sometimes bond in such a way that binding can be moved so that it varies the tightness of the binding.
A device to turn electric current on and off or direct its flow.
A change or exchange.
A movable section of railroad track which allows the train to be directed down one of two destination tracks; (set of) points.
A slender woody plant stem used as a whip; a thin, flexible rod, associated with corporal punishment in the United States.
A command line notation allowing specification of optional behavior.
definitions.example: Use the /b switch to specify black-and-white printing.

definitions.definition: A programming construct that takes different actions depending on the value of an expression.
definitions.example: 2004, "Curt", Can I use IF statements, and still use switches? (on newsgroup microsoft.public.word.mailmerge.fields)

definitions.definition: A networking device connecting multiple wires, allowing them to communicate simultaneously, when possible. Compare to the less efficient hub device that solely duplicates network packets to each wire.
A system of specialized relays, computer hardware, or other equipment which allows the interconnection of a calling party's telephone line with any called party's line.
A mechanism within DNA that activates or deactivates a gene.
(BDSM) One who is willing to take either a submissive or a dominant role in a sexual relationship.
A separate mass or tress of hair, or of some substance (such as jute) made to resemble hair, formerly worn on the head by women.
To exchange.
definitions.example: I want to switch this red dress for a green one.

definitions.definition: To change (something) to the specified state using a switch.
To whip or hit with a switch.
To change places, tasks, etc.
definitions.example: I want to switch to a different seat.

definitions.definition: To get angry suddenly; to quickly or unreasonably become enraged.
To swing or whisk.
To be swung or whisked.
definitions.example: The angry cat's tail switched back and forth.

definitions.definition: To trim.
To turn from one railway track to another; to transfer by a switch; generally with off, from, etc.
definitions.example: to switch off a train; to switch a car from one track to another

definitions.definition: To shift to another circuit.
